_instructions: Define your ideal client profile (ICP). This helps Claude understand who you're trying to reach and how to communicate with them effectively.

demographics.ageRange: All ages - from young professionals to retirees
demographics.income: Mixed income levels - serve all economic brackets
demographics.location: Anderson, SC and surrounding Anderson County areas
demographics.homeOwnership: Homeowners primarily, also commercial property owners and managers
demographics.propertyType: Single-family homes, commercial properties, HOA communities, multi-unit properties
demographics.propertySize: Varies - from small residential lots to larger commercial properties

psychographics.lifestyle: Busy individuals who value their time and want to enjoy their property without the work

primary: No time for lawn work - busy with work, family, and life
Physical limitations - age, health, or mobility issues
Lack of knowledge or equipment - don't know how to maintain lawn properly
Unreliable past providers - been burned by no-shows or poor quality
secondary: Not knowing who to trust for lawn care
frustrations: Companies that don't show up on time
fears: Property value decreasing due to neglect
Damaging their lawn by attempting DIY care

desires: Beautiful curb appeal - pride in how their property looks
Free time and peace of mind - one less thing to worry about
Property value protection - maintain or increase home value
Neighbor approval - keep up with community standards
aspirations: Having the best-looking lawn on the block
More time with family instead of yard work
A property they're proud to show off
goals.successLooksLike: A consistently well-maintained property with reliable service that requires no thought or effort on their part

budget.range: Varies by service - from basic maintenance to full landscaping packages
budget.pricesSensitivity: Mixed - some customers prioritize value, others prioritize lowest price

triggers: Just moved to the area - new homeowners need services
Frustrated with current provider - looking to switch
Life change (baby, new job, health issue) - time becomes more valuable
Property getting neglected - visible lawn problems developing
barriers: Fear of being locked into contracts
Not knowing if company is trustworthy
Previous bad experiences with lawn care companies
influencers: Word of mouth from friends and family
decisionMaking.timeline: Often seasonal - spring is peak decision time, but needs arise year-round

preferences.bestTimeToReach: Evenings and weekends for residential, business hours for commercial

readyToBuy: Mentioned by neighbor who uses Mission Lawn Care
notReady: Just signed contract with another company
Enjoys doing their own yard work
Rental property with landlord handling maintenance
qualificationCriteria: Property within service area (Anderson, SC and surrounding areas)
Has a lawn or landscape needing maintenance

personas.name: Busy Professional Brian
personas.description: 35-year-old professional who works long hours. Values his weekends for family time, not yard work. Recently bought his first home in Anderson.
personas.quote: I'd rather pay someone reliable to handle my lawn so I can spend Saturdays with my kids instead of pushing a mower.
personas.scenario: Brian searches online for 'lawn care Anderson SC' after realizing his new home's lawn is getting out of control and his weekends are too short.

personas.name: Retired Robert
personas.description: 68-year-old retiree who loves his home but can no longer do the physical work. Served in the military and appreciates veteran-owned businesses.
personas.quote: My back just can't handle the mowing anymore, but I want my lawn to look as good as when I did it myself.
personas.scenario: Robert's doctor told him to stop heavy yard work. He asks his neighbor who does their lawn and they recommend Mission Lawn Care.

personas.name: Property Manager Patricia
personas.description: Commercial property manager overseeing multiple properties in the Anderson area. Needs consistent, reliable service for all her accounts.
personas.quote: I need one company I can trust to handle all my properties without me having to micromanage.
personas.scenario: Patricia's current lawn company missed two appointments in a month. She's looking for a more reliable alternative for her 12 commercial properties.

personas.name: New Homeowner Nancy
personas.description: 42-year-old who just relocated to Anderson for work. Doesn't know any local service providers and wants to find someone trustworthy.
personas.quote: I don't know anyone here yet. I just need to find good, honest people to help with home services.
personas.scenario: Nancy moved from out of state and is searching for local lawn care services with good reviews and a trustworthy reputation.
